title: The Talk Show: ‘A Professional Internet User’, With Kagi Founder and CEO Vlad Prelovac
author: John Gruber
excerpt: Kagi founder and CEO Vlad Prelovac joins the show to talk about the business of web search, the thinking behind Kagi’s own amazing search engine, and their upstart WebKit-based browser Orion.
text: The Talk Show ‘A Professional Internet User’, With Vlad Prelovac Tuesday, 24 December 2024 Kagi founder and CEO Vlad Prelovac joins the show to talk about the business of web search, the thinking behind Kagi’s own amazing search engine, and their upstart WebKit-based browser Orion. html:
The Talk Show

‘A Professional Internet User’, With Vlad Prelovac

Tuesday, 24 December 2024

Kagi founder and CEO Vlad Prelovac joins the show to talk about the business of web search, the thinking behind Kagi’s own amazing search engine, and their upstart WebKit-based browser Orion.

Sponsored by:

  • Squarespace: Make your next move. Use code talkshow for 10% off your first order.
  • Memberful: Monetize your passion with membership. Start your free trial today.

Unofficial but surprisingly good transcripts.

Links:

  • Kagi.
  • Kagi Blog.
  • Kagi Search Stats.
  • Kagi Feedback, the Kagi Search issue tracker.
  • Orion — Kagi’s lightweight WebKit-based native browser for Mac and iOS.
  • Vladimir Prelovac’s homepage.
  • Apple’s 1987 “Knowledge Navigator” concept video, which supposedly took place in the “future” of 2011.
    • Wikipedia entry.
    • Daring Fireball, 2011: “The Type of Companies That Publish Future Concept Videos”.
  • Wikipedia: “Essential facilities doctrine”.

This episode of The Talk Show was edited by Caleb Sexton.
